page.title: 13Farming, Swainby & Potto
page.content: There are 25 farms ranging from 20 to 300 acres. Five have{dairy}stock, one a{sheep}suckler herd, one breeds {horses,}the rest mainly arable. Four are tenanted and the others privately owned. Deep fertile boulder clay covers the{land base.}Almost all the area is artificially drained. Fields are 25 acres or less. Principal crops are wheat, barley and oil-seed rape, with a few potatoes and oats. Dairy cattle are Friesian. There is one suckler herd of Angus X. Sheep breeds are Swaledales on a farm with common grazing on the moor, Mashams and Mules at other farms. Four farms have grain driers and all grain had to be dried this year when harvest was late and planting still unfinished in mid-October.{Beehive}space is rented in fields of rape and on a site near the heather in summer.
